comment: TechnicalCabinetDevice schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Energy/master/TechnicalCabinetDevice/schema.json
description: Technical Cabinet Device Data Model is intended to to describe the technical characteristics of the Device, designed to be placed in an urban or interurban environment. The main objective of these cabinets for this Data Model is to protect the electrical equipment necessary for the control, surveillance, reading and management of urban lighting, signaling, video and electrical distribution. The scope of use of some of these cabinets can extend to an additional protection for installations of modular apparat

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: brandName
contents.comment: Name of the brand

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateLastReported
contents.comment: A timestamp which denotes the last time when the device successfully reported data. Date and time in an ISO8601 UTCformat

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: documentation
contents.comment: A link to device's documentation

contents.name: doorCount
contents.comment: Count of doors of the technical Cabinet.

contents.name: doorOpeningAngle
contents.comment: Door opening angle expressed in decimal degrees with a range from 0 to 180 degree. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **DD** represents Decimal Degrees.

contents.name: manufacturerName
contents.comment: Name of the manufacturer

contents.name: maximumSystemVoltage
contents.comment: Maximum system voltage permitted for the **module**. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **VLT** represents Volt

contents.name: modelName
contents.comment: Name of the model as given by the manufacturer.

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: protectionIK
contents.comment: IK '*Mecanic Protection*' level relating to numeric classification for the degrees of protection provided by enclosures for electrical equipment against external mechanical impacts, according to International Electro technical Commission standard (EN 62-262). - IK varies from 0 (minimum resistance) to 10 (maximum resistance) which represents an Impact Energy (Unit Joule)

contents.name: protectionIP
contents.comment: IP 'Ingress Protection' for the Junction Box. This is the level classifies and rates the degree of protection provided by mechanical casings and electrical enclosures against intrusion, dust, accidental contact, and water according to International Electrotechnical Commission standard (EN 60-529). First digit: Solid particle protection (Single numeral: 06 or 'X'). Second digit: Liquid ingress protection (Single numeral: 09 or 'X' ).Third digit: Personal Protection against access to dangerous parts (optional

contents.name: serialNumber
contents.comment: Serial number of the container

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: weight
contents.comment: Weight of the item. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **KGM** represents Kilograms

contents.name: application
contents.comment: Target application of the Device regarding the environment. A combination of these values. Enum:'commercial, distributionService, industrial, other, publicWorks, road, tertiary, urbanService'

contents.name: designMaterials
contents.comment: Design materials to build the cabinet. A combination of  these values. Enum:'ABS-Plastic, aluminum, fiberGlass, galvanizedSteel, other, polyester, stainlessSteel'

contents.name: doorClosingMode
contents.comment: Door closing mode. A unique value of these values. Enum:'fixedHandle, other, revolvingHandle, triangleHandle'

contents.name: exteriorCoating
contents.comment: Interior Coating. A combination of these values. Enum:'fiberGlass, other, plastic, polyester, polyesterResin, steel

contents.name: exteriorFinish
contents.comment: Exterior finish. A combination of these values. Enum:'graffiti, other, raised, roughcast, smooth, textured'

contents.name: installationCondition
contents.comment: Condition and possibility of use in the following environments. A combination of these values. Enum:'desert, dust, extremeCold, extremeClimate, extremeHeat, extremeHumidity, marine, none, other, saline, seismic, sand'

contents.name: interiorCoating
contents.comment: Interior Coating. A combination of these values. Enum:'fiberGlass, heatInsulating, other, plastic, polyester, polyesterResin, steel'

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: protectionOthers
contents.comment: Others protection of the technical cabinet. A combination of these values. Enum:'abrasion, basement, dampProof, display, doorTearing, dust, forcedOpening, graffiti, insect, other, roofOverload, saltSpray, shielding, solar, vandalism, water'

contents.name: refDeviceList
contents.comment: A list of reference to the [Devices](https://github.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Device/blob/master/Device/doc/spec.md) which are inside the technical Cabinet Device.

contents.name: ventilationMode
contents.comment: Ventilation mode. A combination of these values. Enum:'airConditioners, dehumidifier, none, other, selfVentilatedGills'

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address

contents.name: dimension
contents.comment: The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CMT** represents Centimeter.

contents.name: internalDimension
contents.comment: Internal dimension corresponding to the place to work inside the technical cabinet. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CMT** represents Centimeter

contents.name: operatingTemperature
contents.comment: Ambient operating temperature range. This is the minimum and maximum resistance to cold and heat. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CEL** represents Degree Celsius.
